history.proof: intros H1 H2. unfold fractran_regular in H2. induction l as [|h t]. - contradiction. - hauto l: on depth: 3.

Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.

Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

fractran_stop = fun l (x : nat) => forall z : nat, ~ l /F/ x → z : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_stop _%list_scope _%nat_scope
fractran_step_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
fractran_step_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> SProp, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
Inductive fractran_step : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop := in_fractran_0 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y | in_fractran_1 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y Arguments fractran_step _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_0 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_1 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
fractran_step_inv : forall (P : list (nat * nat)) (x y : nat), P /F/ x → y -> exists l (p q : nat) (r : list (nat * nat)), P = l ++ (p, q) :: r /\ (forall u v : nat, In (u, v) l -> ~ divides v (u * x)) /\ q * y = p * x
fractran_step_zero : forall l, Forall (fun c : nat * nat => fst c <> 0) l -> forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> l /F/ x → y < -> remove_zero_den l /F/ x → y
fractran_step_bound : forall l, fractran_regular l -> {k : nat | forall x y : nat, l /F/ x → y -> y <= k * x}
fractran_step_no_zero_num : forall l, Forall (fun c : nat * nat => fst c <> 0) l -> forall x y : nat, l /F/ x → y -> y = 0 -> x = 0
fractran_step_head_not_zero : forall (p q : nat) l (y : nat), q <> 0 -> (p, q) :: l /F/ 0 → y -> y = 0
fractran_step_no_zero_den : forall l (x y : nat), fractran_regular l -> l /F/ x → y -> x = 0 -> y = 0
fractran_step_fun : forall l (x y1 y2 : nat), fractran_regular l -> l /F/ x → y1 -> l /F/ x → y2 -> y1 = y2
fractran_terminates = fun l (x : nat) => exists y : nat, fractran_compute l x y /\ fractran_stop l y : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_terminates _%list_scope _%nat_scope
fractran_steps = fun l => rel_iter (fractran_step l) : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_steps _%list_scope (_ _ _)%nat_scope
in_fractran_1 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y
FRACTRAN_REG_PROBLEM = {l : list (nat * nat) & {_ : nat | fractran_regular l}} : Set

```coq
intros H1 H2.
unfold fractran_regular in H2.
induction l as [|h t].
- intros H3. contradiction.
- intros H3 H4.
  specialize (H2 (h :: t) (or_introl eq_refl)).
  destruct h as [n1 n2].
  simpl in H2. inversion H2. subst.
  destruct n2.
  + intros H5. inversion H5.
  + intros H5 H6. simpl. rewrite app_nil_l.
    unfold fractran_step in H4.
    inversion H4. subst.
    unfold remove_zero_den in H2.
    simpl in H2.
    rewrite H2.
    unfold "/".
    exists (n2 * x). symmetry. apply Nat.mul_comm.
Qed.
Qed.```

original: intros H1 H2. unfold fractran_regular in H2. induction l as [|h t]. - intros H3. contradiction. - intros H3 H4. specialize (H2 (h :: t) (or_introl eq_refl)). destruct h as [n1 n2]. simpl in H2. inversion H2. subst. destruct n2. + intros H5. inversion H5. + intros H5 H6. simpl. rewrite app_nil_l. unfold fractran_step in H4. inversion H4. subst. unfold remove_zero_den in H2. simpl in H2. rewrite H2. unfold "/". exists (n2 * x). symmetry. apply Nat.mul_comm.
